workflow.name: Find high-quality remote jobs with OpenAI, Decodo, and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
##  What this workflow does

This workflow automates the discovery, evaluation, and notification of job opportunities based on a candidate‚Äôs professional profile.

It fetches remote job listings, compares each role against a structured candidate profile stored in Google Sheets, and uses AI to evaluate real alignment in terms of skills, seniority, salary, industry, and role complexity.

Only the most relevant opportunities are kept, stored in Google Sheets, and delivered via email as a Top 5 shortlist.

[Decodo ‚Äì Web Scraper for n8n](https://visit.decodo.com/raqXGD)



## How to configure (quick setup)

1. Define the candidate profile in Google Sheets (skills, salary expectations, preferences).
![image.png](fileId:3866)

2. Configure credentials (Google Sheets, Gmail, decodo, AI provider).

3. Set the matching threshold (e.g. skill match ‚â• 90%).

4. Run the workflow manually or on a schedule.

### Output

Structured job match results in Google Sheets

Automated email with the Top 5 best-matched job opportunities

![image.png](fileId:3867)

workflow.name: Find High-Quality Remote Jobs with AI, Decodo, and Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## What this workflow does

This workflow automates the discovery, evaluation, and notification of job opportunities based on a candidate‚Äôs professional profile.

It fetches remote job listings, compares each role against a structured candidate profile stored in Google Sheets, and uses AI to evaluate real alignment in terms of skills, seniority, salary, industry, and role complexity.

Only the most relevant opportunities are kept, stored in Google Sheets, and delivered via email as a Top 5 shortlist.
[Decodo ‚Äì Web Scraper for n8n](https://visit.decodo.com/raqXGD)

## How to configure (quick setup)
1. Define the candidate profile in Google Sheets (skills, salary expectations, preferences).
2. Configure credentials (Google Sheets, Gmail, decodo, AI provider).
3. Set the matching threshold (e.g. skill match ‚â• 90%).
4. Run the workflow manually or on a schedule.

## Output
- Structured job match results in Google Sheets  
- Automated email with the Top 5 best-matched job opportunities

## 1. Candidate profile input
Reads the candidate profile from Google Sheets.

##  2. Data collection & AI scoring
- Fetches remote job listings using Decodo.
- Extracts structured job data 
- Combines each job with the candidate profile.
- An AI agent evaluates fit based on skills, salary, and industry.

## 3.Results & notifications
- Filters jobs based on a minimum fit score.
- Saves qualified matches to Google Sheets for tracking.
- Builds an HTML email with the Top 5 job matches.
-Sends the summary via Gmail.

nodes.name: Score fit with AI (salary + skills + industry)

parameters.text:
=You will receive a JSON object with all job posting fields and all candidate profile fields already merged.

### INPUT JSON:
{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

Using ONLY this JSON, evaluate how well the job matches the candidate profile.

Return ONLY this JSON structure:

{
  "fit_score": <0-100>,
  "salary_score": <0-100>,
  "skill_match_percentage": <0-100>,
  "industry_match": "<high/medium/low/unknown>",
  "industry_match_score": <0-100>,
  "missing_skills": [],
  "matching_skills": [],
  "salary_alignment": "<above/below/matching/unknown>",
  "location_match": "<yes/no/maybe/unknown>",
  "job_complexity_score": <0-100>,
  "seniority_match": "<yes/no/maybe/unknown>",
  "alignment_explanation": "<3-6 short factual sentences>",
  "final_recommendation": "<yes/no/maybe>"
}

### RULES:
- Use the System Prompt scoring weights:
  - 40% salary alignment
  - 40% skills match
  - 20% industry match
- Salary:
  - Compare job minSalary/maxSalary/currency vs candidate salary_expectation.
  - If salary is missing, set salary_alignment to "unknown".
- Skills:
  - matching_skills = skills in candidate "skills" that appear in job "description".
  - missing_skills = job-required skills inferred from description not present in candidate "skills".
- Industry:
  - Compare job description/company against candidate "preferred_industries".
  - Use "no_go" as negative signal.
- seniority_match is informational only and must NOT impact the fit_score.
- job_complexity_score must reflect difficulty inferred from "description".
- Output MUST be valid JSON. No commentary, no explanation outside JSON.

options.systemMessage:
You are a Job Matching Engine. 
Your role is to evaluate how well a job posting matches a candidate's personal profile.

The candidate has clearly stated that the most important factors are:
1) Salary alignment
2) Relevant skills
3) Industry match
Overall "fit" should prioritize those above everything else.

Rules:
- Always return clean, valid JSON.
- Base your evaluation ONLY on the data provided in the candidate profile and the job posting.
- Be objective. No motivational or emotional language.

Scoring logic:
- fit_score must be based on this weighted system:
    - 40% salary alignment
    - 40% skills match
    - 20% industry match
- salary_score must reflect how close the offered salary is to the candidate's expectations.
- skill_match_percentage must reflect the overlap between candidate skills and job-required skills.
- industry_match_score must measure how close the job's industry is to the candidate's preferred industries.
- seniority_match is OPTIONAL and purely informational. It MUST NOT affect fit_score.

Other fields:
- job_complexity_score must reflect how advanced or demanding the role appears based on the description.
- final_recommendation must be one of: "yes", "no", or "maybe".
- Explanations must be short, clear, and factual.
- Never invent information not present in the job or profile.
- If salary or industry are missing, say so explicitly and adjust scores accordingly, but do not make up numbers.

nodes.name: Flatten AI scores into job fields
Check whether the fit score is greater than X

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
